author: jwasinger
content: for devnet 2, there is an interaction between 7928 and 7843 because they both change the block header format.  atm, for geth I've chosen to put the bal hash before the slot number.

author: matkt0
content: I checked the 7843 PR in Besu and it's the same balhash is before slot number

author: matkt0
content: just to share . we also have eip 4844 and 7918 failing tests on our side (all blob related)

author: jwasinger
content: <@796570016966770688> I looked into a test that fails for geth `static/state_tests/stStaticFlagEnabled/CallWithNOTZeroValueToPrecompileFromCalledContract.json/tests/static/state_tests/stStaticFlagEnabled/CallWithNOTZeroValueToPrecompileFromCalledContractFiller.yml::CallWithNOTZeroValueToPrecompileFromCalledContract[fork_Amsterdam-blockchain_test_from_state_test-d7]`.  It appears that this test makes a call to a precompile which isn't recorded as a read in the BAL included with the test case, based on what I have seen examining the RLP included under `blockchain_tests_engine`.

author: matkt0
content: what is the missing read ? it's passing on my side the test

author: jwasinger
content: a call to `0x08` (bn256 pairing) didn't record that account as a read in the BAL.

author: jwasinger
content: the weird thing is that we have specific tests for this

author: matkt0
content: Yes from what I see in the besu code it seems we are not adding the precompile address if we transfert zero

author: matkt0
content: but as you said strange that we didn't found that before

author: jwasinger
content: transfer with no value should be covered here: https://github.com/ethereum/execution-specs/blob/tests-bal@v3.0.1/tests/amsterdam/eip7928_block_level_access_lists/test_block_access_lists.py#L1397-L1398

author: matkt0
content: I tried to debug the tests CallWithNOTZeroValueToPrecompileFromCalledContract and I don't see any call to 0x08

author: jwasinger
content: Ah, it's an error in Geth.  I see the cause now

author: gurukamath
content: From what I can see in the specs, there is an attempted call to the `0x08` pre-compile with some value. But the call does not go through since the context is static

author: m0_ox
content: Yep. I thought these tests were very good to have and I put up a PR to port them to Python so we can extend the coverage to all precompiles https://github.com/ethereum/execution-specs/pull/1960
